logic.bankSelection

Class Bank

  • java.lang.Object
    • logic.bankSelection.Bank

  • public class Bank
extends java.lang.Object
    Bank holding an array of entries (information about the selected dominos)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Bank

        public Bank(int playerCnt)
        Constructor setting the player count, used in the game.
        Parameters:
        playerCnt - number of players participating in the game is equivalent to the number of bank slots required

      • Bank

        public Bank(Entry[] entries,
            java.util.Random pseudoRandom)
        Constructor setting the entries. Used for testing.
        Parameters:
        entries - entries of the bank
        pseudoRandom - random object of the bank (for testing purpose)

      • Bank

        public Bank(java.lang.String preallocation,
            java.util.List<Player> players,
            java.util.Random rand)
        Constructor used for testing / fileIO.
        Parameters:
        preallocation - String representation of the dominos in the bank
        players - List of players to which the entries will be linked. Number of players determines the bank size.
        rand - random object used when drawing dominos for the next round

    • Method Detail

      • setRand

        public void setRand(java.util.Random rand)
        Setter for the random object (used in tests)
        Parameters:
        rand - random that will be put as the instance's random object

      • getSelectedDominoIdx

        public int getSelectedDominoIdx(Player player)
        Getter for a specific domino selected by the given player
        Parameters:
        player - player who selected the desired domino
        Returns:
        domino which the given player selected

      • getAllDominos

        public Domino[] getAllDominos()
        Generates an array of dominos from objects entry array. Used to for copying banks. Empty slots are denoted by a nullpointer. An array might look like this: new Domino[] {null, new Domino(...), null, null};
        Returns:
        dominos on this bank, null for empty slots

      • getDomino

        public Domino getDomino(int idx)
        Getter for a specific domino on the bank
        Parameters:
        idx - index of the domino
        Returns:
        the domino at the given index, null if index is invalid or the slot is empty.

      • getSelectedPlayer

        public Player getSelectedPlayer(int idx)
        Generates the player who selected the domino at a given position
        Parameters:
        idx - idx of the domino which was selected
        Returns:
        selected player from a given index

      • updateDomino

        public void updateDomino(int bankIdx,
                         Domino dom)
        Setter for a given Domino at the given bank index
        Parameters:
        bankIdx - bank index at which the domino will be updated
        dom - domino reference to override the current domino instance

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Determinies if the bank is empty or not
        Returns:
        true when all entries are null pointers

      • clearAllEntries

        public void clearAllEntries()
        Sets all entries equal to null

        public void deleteEntry(int entryIdx)
        Deletes a specific entry with a given index
        Parameters:
        entryIdx - index of the entry that will deleted

        public void deleteEntry(Player player)
        Deleted a speceific entry of a given player
        Parameters:
        player - refernce of a player whos entry will be deleted

      • selectEntry

        public void selectEntry(Player player,
                        int bankIdx)
        Selects a entry at a given bank index
        Parameters:
        player - reference of the player to select the entry at the given index
        bankIdx - index for the domino on the bank

      • isNotSelected

        public boolean isNotSelected(int domIdx)
        Checks if a slot on the bank at the given index isn't already selected by another player
        Parameters:
        domIdx - index for the domino that needs to be checked
        Returns:
        true if bank index isn't already selected by another player

      • getPlayerSelectedDomino

        public Domino getPlayerSelectedDomino(Player player)
        Gets the domino the given player selected earlier on in the game
        Parameters:
        player - player which selected a domino
        Returns:
        the domino which the player selected, null if there is no such domino.

      • randomlyDrawFromStack

        public java.util.List<Domino> randomlyDrawFromStack(java.util.List<Domino> stack)
        Draws a random domino from the given stack
        Parameters:
        stack - list of dominos currently in the stack
        Returns:
        List of dominos equivalent to the banksize. (Dominos will be sorted and removed from the input stack)

      • fill

        public void fill(java.util.List<Domino> domList)
        Fills all entries with a given list
        Parameters:
        domList - list to set the entries with

      • fill

        public void fill(Domino domino,
                 int idx)
        Setter for a given entry index
        Parameters:
        domino - domino to be set in the given entry, domino may be null
        idx - index of the entry that will be modified

      • copy

        public Bank copy()
        Makes a copy of the bank, references to the individual entries stay the same. Used in game class when the next round bank entries are copied to the current round bank
        Returns:
        a copy of the bank, references to the individual entries stay the same
